Lancaster in Context

Lancaster City Council serves 144,246 residents — nearly twice the population of Burnley (88,600) and more than double Ribble Valley (61,561). Its annual spend of approximately £35.4 million translates to roughly £245 per head.

Service Expenditure

GOV.UK data for 2024-25 shows Lancaster's service spending profile per head:

  • Environmental: £7,941k — the highest of any council we track
  • Central services: £7,130k — also the highest
  • Planning: £6,056k — second only to its own central services
  • Cultural: £4,850k — reflecting investment in arts, tourism, and heritage
  • Housing: £4,271k — the highest housing spend of all eight councils

Lancaster's total service expenditure of £27,919k is the highest of all eight councils, reflecting its larger scale and broader service responsibilities as a city council.
